question:
Identify the national park with the help of given information:
  1. It was founded in 1970 and declared as a national park in 1974
  2. It is the first biological park in India to have a fenced forested elephant sanctuary
  3. It is also the first in the country to have a “butterfly conservatory”
Select the correct answer from options given below:
explanation: Bannerghatta is the first biological park in India to have a fenced forested elephant sanctuary. On 25 November 2006, Kapil Sibal, the then Union Minister of Science and Technology opened India\'s first butterfly enclosure at the park. This national park is located about 22 km south of Bangalore in the hills of the Anekal range.
